dc.title: Coastal and Marine Geology Program - U.S. Geological Survey
dc.description: The U.S. Geological Survey's Coastal and Marine Geology Program studies issues in deep-water, coastal, estuarine, and lacustrine realms, such as coral reefs, gas hydrate, coastal hazards (including erosion, hurricane impacts, and tsunamis), and environmental change (including sea-level rise, pollution, and El Nino).
